This action will start preparing the dis: This action will start preparing the disk for replacement.
Are you sure you want to replace <1>{{di: Are you sure you want to replace <1>{{diskName}}</1> ?
Name: Name
<0>{{diskName}}</0> can be replaced with: <0>{{diskName}}</0> can be replaced with a disk of same type.
All other capacity usage that are not a: All other capacity usage that are not a part of the top 5 consumers.
This card shows the used capacity for Us: This card shows the used capacity for Usable storage, broken-down by different kubernetes resources. Usable storage is all the data that can be stored in the system after decreasing the replication policies.
Raw capacity is the absolute total disk: Raw capacity is the absolute total disk space available to the array subsystem.
The ratio of the data physical stored (a: The ratio of the data physical stored (after compression) compared to the size of the data received from the client.
The amount of physical storage saved aft: The amount of physical storage saved after applying compression.
The uploaded file is not a valid JSON fi: The uploaded file is not a valid JSON file
Download <1>{{SCRIPT_NAME}}</1> script a: Download <1>{{SCRIPT_NAME}}</1> script and run on the RHCS cluster, then upload the results(JSON) in the External cluster metadata field.
A bucket will be created to provide the: A bucket will be created to provide the OCS Service.
Adding capacity for <1>{{name}}</1>, may: Adding capacity for <1>{{name}}</1>, may increase your expenses.
Vault enterprise namespaces are isolated: Vault enterprise namespaces are isolated environments that functionally exist as Vaults within a Vault. They have separate login paths and support creating and managing data isolated to their namespace.
Maximum file size exceeded. File limit i: Maximum file size exceeded. File limit is 4MB.
A PEM-encoded CA certificate file used t: A PEM-encoded CA certificate file used to verify the Vault server's SSL certificate.
A PEM-encoded client certificate. This c: A PEM-encoded client certificate. This certificate is used for TLS communication with the Vault server.
An unencrypted, PEM-encoded private key: An unencrypted, PEM-encoded private key which corresponds to the matching client certificate provided with VAULT_CLIENT_CERT.
The name to use as the SNI host when Ope: The name to use as the SNI host when OpenShift Container Storage connecting via TLS to the Vault server
The name must be accurate and must match: The name must be accurate and must match the service namespace
A Storage pool is a logical entity provi: A Storage pool is a logical entity providing elastic capacity to applications and workloads. Pools provide a means of supporting policies for access data resilience and storage efficiency.
Enabling compression may result in littl: Enabling compression may result in little or no space savings for encrypted or random data. Also, enabling compression may have an impact on I/O performance.
The storage cluster needs to use a stora: The storage cluster needs to use a storage class to consume the local storage. In order to create one you need to discover the available disks and create a storage class using the filters to select the disks you wish to use
Can be used on any platform. It means th: Can be used on any platform. It means that OCS uses attached disks, via Local Storage Operator. In this case, the infrastructure storage class is actually provided by LSO, on top of attached drives.
Selecting all nodes will use the availab: Selecting all nodes will use the available disks that match the selected filters on all nodes selected on previous step.
The OCS storage cluster require a minimu: The OCS storage cluster require a minimum of 3 nodes for the intial deployment. Only {{nodes}} node match to the selected filters. Please adjust the filters to include more nodes.
After the volume set and storage class a: After the volume set and storage class are created you won't be able to go back to this step.
Are you sure you want to continue?: Are you sure you want to continue?
selected based on the created storage cl: selected based on the created storage class:
Total CPU and memory of {{cpu, number}}: Total CPU and memory of {{cpu, number}} CPU and {{memory}}
Connect to external key management servi: Connect to external key management service: {{name}}
Before we can create a storage cluster,: Before we can create a storage cluster, the local storage operator needs to be installed. When installation is finished come back to OpenShift Container Storage to create a storage cluster.<1><0>Install</0></1>
clusterExistText: A storage cluster <1>{{clusterName}}</1> already exists.<3></3>You cannot create another storage cluster.
OCS runs as a cloud-native service for o: OCS runs as a cloud-native service for optimal integration with applications in need of storage and handles the scenes such as provisioning and management.
The selected nodes will be labeled with: The selected nodes will be labeled with <1>{{label}}</1> (unless they are already labeled). {{replica}} of the selected nodes will be used for initial deployment. The remaining nodes will be used by OpenShift as scheduling targets for OCS scaling.
To support high availability when two da: To support high availability when two data centers can be used, enable arbiter to get the valid quorum between two data centers.
The storage cluster encryption level can: The storage cluster encryption level can be set to include all components under the cluster (including storage class and PVs) or to include only storage class encryption. PV encryption can use an auth token that will be used with the KMS configuration to allow multi-tenancy.
Data encryption for block and file stora: Data encryption for block and file storage. MultiCloud Object Gateway is always encrypted.
Encryption for the entire cluster (block: Encryption for the entire cluster (block and file)
An encryption key will be generated for: An encryption key will be generated for each persistent volume (block) created using an encryption enabled storageclass.
Connect to an external key management se: Connect to an external key management service
Select at least 3 nodes preferably in 3: Select at least 3 nodes preferably in 3 different zones. It is recommended to start with at least 14 CPUs and 34 GiB per node.
create internal mode storage cluster wiz: create internal mode storage cluster wizard
Can be used on any platform, except bare: Can be used on any platform, except bare metal. It means that OCS uses an infrastructure storage class, provided by the hosting platform. For example, gp2 on AWS, thin on VMWare, etc.
This is an Advanced subscription feature: This is an Advanced subscription feature. It requires Advanced Edition subscription. Please contact the account team for more information.
Storage pool into which volume data shal: Storage pool into which volume data shall be stored
An encryption key will be generated for: An encryption key will be generated for each persistent volume created using this storageclass.
Encrypted PVs cannot be cloned expanded: Encrypted PVs cannot be cloned expanded or create snapshots.
The last saved values will be updated: The last saved values will be updated
The Storage Class will be used to reques: The Storage Class will be used to request storage from the underlying infrastructure to create the backing persistent volumes that will be used to provide the OpenShift Container Storage (OCS) service.
The backing storage requested will be hi: The backing storage requested will be higher as it will factor in the requested capacity replica factor and fault tolerant costs associated with the requested capacity.
If you wish to use the Arbiter stretch c: If you wish to use the Arbiter stretch cluster, a minimum of 4 nodes (2 different zones, 2 nodes per zone) and 1 additional zone with 1 node is required. All nodes must be pre-labeled with zones in order to be validated on cluster creation.
Selected nodes are based on the selected: Selected nodes are based on the selected storage class. The selected nodes will preferably be in 3 different zones with a recommended requirement of 14 CPUs and 34 GiB per node.
Selected nodes are based on the selected storage class. 4 nodes in 2 different zones will be selected with a recommended requirement of 14 CPU and 34 GiB RAM per node.
A minimal cluster deployment will be per: A minimal cluster deployment will be performed.
The selected nodes do not match the OCS: The selected nodes do not match the OCS storage cluster requirement of an aggregated 30 CPUs and 72 GiB of RAM. If the selection cannot be modified a minimal cluster will be deployed.
Select a storage class to continue: Select a storage class to continue
This is a required field. The Storage Cl: This is a required field. The Storage Class will be used to request storage from the underlying infrastructure to create the backing persistent volumes that will be used to provide the OpenShift Container Storage (OCS) service.
All required fields are not set: All required fields are not set
In order to create the storage cluster y: In order to create the storage cluster you must set the storage class select at least 3 nodes (preferably in 3 different zones) and meet the minimum or recommended requirement
The OCS Storage cluster require a minimu: The OCS Storage cluster require a minimum of 3 nodes for the initial deployment. Please choose a different storage class or go to create a new volume set that matches the minimum node requirement.
Select at least 1 encryption level or di: Select at least 1 encryption level or disable encryption.
Fill out the details in order to connect: Fill out the details in order to connect to key management system
Public Network Attachment Definition can: Public Network Attachment Definition cannot be empty
To use Multus networking the public Netw: To use Multus networking the public Network Attachment Definition must be selected.
The number of selected zones is less tha: The number of selected zones is less than the minimum requirement of 3. If not modified a host-based failure domain deployment will be enforced.
When all the selected nodes in the stora: When all the selected nodes in the storage class are in a single zone the cluster will be using a host-based failure domain.
An error occurred Pool {name} was not cr: An error occurred Pool {name} was not created
Pool {name} creation timed out. Please c: Pool {name} creation timed out. Please check if ocs-operator and rook operator are running
The creation of an OCS storage cluster i: The creation of an OCS storage cluster is still in progress or has failed. Please try again after the storage cluster is ready to use.
